channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Llama 2: Open Foundation and Fine-Tuned Chat Models
item.description: In this work, we develop and release Llama 2, a collection of pretrained and fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) ranging in scale from 7 billion to 70 billion parameters.

item.title: FABRIC: Personalizing Diffusion Models with Iterative Feedback
item.description: In an era where visual content generation is increasingly driven by machine learning, the integration of human feedback into generative models presents significant opportunities for enhancing user experience and output quality.

item.title: How is ChatGPT's behavior changing over time?
item.description: We find that the performance and behavior of both GPT-3. 5 and GPT-4 can vary greatly over time.

item.title: Meta-Transformer: A Unified Framework for Multimodal Learning
item.description: Multimodal learning aims to build models that can process and relate information from multiple modalities.

item.title: AnimateDiff: Animate Your Personalized Text-to-Image Diffusion Models without Specific Tuning
item.description: With the advance of text-to-image models (e. g., Stable Diffusion) and corresponding personalization techniques such as DreamBooth and LoRA, everyone can manifest their imagination into high-quality images at an affordable cost.

item.title: Semantic-SAM: Segment and Recognize Anything at Any Granularity
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Semantic-SAM, a universal image segmentation model to enable segment and recognize anything at any desired granularity.

item.title: Petals: Collaborative Inference and Fine-tuning of Large Models
item.description: However, these techniques have innate limitations: offloading is too slow for interactive inference, while APIs are not flexible enough for research that requires access to weights, attention or logits.

item.title: CoTracker: It is Better to Track Together
item.description: In this paper, we thus propose CoTracker, an architecture that jointly tracks multiple points throughout an entire video.

item.title: FlashAttention-2: Faster Attention with Better Parallelism and Work Partitioning
item.description: We observe that the inefficiency is due to suboptimal work partitioning between different thread blocks and warps on the GPU, causing either low-occupancy or unnecessary shared memory reads/writes.

item.title: FLASK: Fine-grained Language Model Evaluation based on Alignment Skill Sets
item.description: In this paper, we introduce FLASK (Fine-grained Language Model Evaluation based on Alignment SKill Sets), a fine-grained evaluation protocol that can be used for both model-based and human-based evaluation which decomposes coarse-level scoring to an instance-wise skill set-level.

item.title: Exploiting Diffusion Prior for Real-World Image Super-Resolution
item.description: We present a novel approach to leverage prior knowledge encapsulated in pre-trained text-to-image diffusion models for blind super-resolution (SR).

item.title: Metric3D: Towards Zero-shot Metric 3D Prediction from A Single Image
item.description: State-of-the-art (SOTA) monocular metric depth estimation methods can only handle a single camera model and are unable to perform mixed-data training due to the metric ambiguity.

item.title: CNOS: A Strong Baseline for CAD-based Novel Object Segmentation
item.description: We propose a simple three-stage approach to segment unseen objects in RGB images using their CAD models.

item.title: Planting a SEED of Vision in Large Language Model
item.description: Research on image tokenizers has previously reached an impasse, as frameworks employing quantized visual tokens have lost prominence due to subpar performance and convergence in multimodal comprehension (compared to BLIP-2, etc.)

item.title: Neural Video Depth Stabilizer
item.description: Video depth estimation aims to infer temporally consistent depth.

item.title: h2oGPT: Democratizing Large Language Models
item.description: Applications built on top of Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT-4 represent a revolution in AI due to their human-level capabilities in natural language processing.

item.title: L-Eval: Instituting Standardized Evaluation for Long Context Language Models
item.description: Recently, there has been growing interest in extending the context length of instruction-following models in order to effectively process single-turn long input (e. g. summarizing a paper) and conversations with more extensive histories.

item.title: Copy Is All You Need
item.description: The dominant text generation models compose the output by sequentially selecting words from a fixed vocabulary.

item.title: Efficient Approximations of Complete Interatomic Potentials for Crystal Property Prediction
item.description: This is enabled by our approximations of infinite potential summations with provable error bounds.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence for Science in Quantum, Atomistic, and Continuum Systems
item.description: Advances in artificial intelligence (AI) are fueling a new paradigm of discoveries in natural sciences.
